Node.js versus Next.js - A React Approach

Interview

<a href="https://bryan-guner.gitbook.io/my-docs/v/mynotes/interview/question-set-1" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-42olwf r-rs99b7 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-15ysp7h r-ymttw5 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

Question Set #1:

<a href="https://www.gitbook.com/?utm_source=content&amp;utm_medium=trademark&amp;utm_campaign=-MWyt4j29ReMyImgcaO7" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1uwl36a r-z2wwpe r-1rasi3h r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-1fdo3w0 r-1mnahxq r-ymttw5 r-5njf8e r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-eu3ka r-1aockid" /></a>

Powered By <span class="css-901oao css-16my406 r-b88u0q">GitBook</span>

JSX

# 

<span key="cdf0a80f3872499aa0b6e1e608313363"><span offset-key="cdf0a80f3872499aa0b6e1e608313363:0">Introducing JSX</span></span>

<span key="20ad7a2fd0e247d3b7222953cb39a731"><span offset-key="20ad7a2fd0e247d3b7222953cb39a731:0">Consider this variable declaration:</span></span>

1

<span key="5a447213e01a4f0f99841d5cb26fbbe5"><span offset-key="5a447213e01a4f0f99841d5cb26fbbe5:0">const element = &lt;h1>Hello, world!&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="7182dfb182dc4509910eeeb6dc8a2bb2"><span offset-key="7182dfb182dc4509910eeeb6dc8a2bb2:0">This funny tag syntax is neither a string nor HTML.</span></span>

<span key="383eaba2265243999a1a36d025380cf7"><span offset-key="383eaba2265243999a1a36d025380cf7:0">It is called JSX, and it is a syntax extension to JavaScript. We recommend using it with React to describe what the UI should look like. JSX may remind you of a template language, but it comes with the full power of JavaScript.</span></span>

<span key="e9695478487647798334076b548a1c11"><span offset-key="e9695478487647798334076b548a1c11:0">JSX produces React “elements”. We will explore rendering them to the DOM in the </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/rendering-elements.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="42603f1569a3410890d41fe70b953a0e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="dc702e68e97241c687b70007d7e3e0d1"><span data-offset-key="dc702e68e97241c687b70007d7e3e0d1:0">next section</span></span></span></a><span key="3c00be5930294ee2b630f8cd65742ab2"><span offset-key="3c00be5930294ee2b630f8cd65742ab2:0">. Below, you can find the basics of JSX necessary to get you started.</span></span>

## 

<span key="60dd564cc2a44aaa889bf529aea94178"><span offset-key="60dd564cc2a44aaa889bf529aea94178:0">Why JSX?</span></span>

<span key="5a28a2f133c24e409c22b94a7bb70fc7"><span offset-key="5a28a2f133c24e409c22b94a7bb70fc7:0">React embraces the fact that rendering logic is inherently coupled with other UI logic: how events are handled, how the state changes over time, and how the data is prepared for display.</span></span>

<span key="eadb43f3fe144513acf74d400c3720f2"><span offset-key="eadb43f3fe144513acf74d400c3720f2:0">Instead of artificially separating </span>*technologies*<span offset-key="eadb43f3fe144513acf74d400c3720f2:2"> by putting markup and logic in separate files, React </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Separation_of_concerns" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="559ffa7a2bd44ef2b17fd22a9529b397" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="4ddfb987d4ab424c961509e605d47874"><span data-offset-key="4ddfb987d4ab424c961509e605d47874:0">separates </span><em>concerns</em></span></span></a><span key="0af6e5ffcd704533a58ae9e1cb50a1bf"><span offset-key="0af6e5ffcd704533a58ae9e1cb50a1bf:0"> with loosely coupled units called “components” that contain both. We will come back to components in a </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/components-and-props.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fe6593e047d84779be50d8f14c0e434f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="b885841060dc4e4b8672c67d0c5d630c"><span data-offset-key="b885841060dc4e4b8672c67d0c5d630c:0">further section</span></span></span></a><span key="92581fd6ec97437fb1e6893ba2ecdd82"><span offset-key="92581fd6ec97437fb1e6893ba2ecdd82:0">, but if you’re not yet comfortable putting markup in JS, </span></span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7cQ3mrcKaY" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5839fcf15d2643b28839ead71fbafe68" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="167df2176c8d48d7b91b64237d083317"><span data-offset-key="167df2176c8d48d7b91b64237d083317:0">this talk</span></span></span></a><span key="6e46517c33a647af93f610c3b1c1ebb5"><span offset-key="6e46517c33a647af93f610c3b1c1ebb5:0"> might convince you otherwise.</span></span>

<span key="f4d706fce303470a9445d2629f87127e"><span offset-key="f4d706fce303470a9445d2629f87127e:0">React </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/react-without-jsx.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="eb849862821544148082419260e992ad" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="8d67bed9481842a1899921aa7ef6d35b"><span data-offset-key="8d67bed9481842a1899921aa7ef6d35b:0">doesn’t require</span></span></span></a><span key="426a3a0822e64d26b7615ff5f376743e"><span offset-key="426a3a0822e64d26b7615ff5f376743e:0"> using JSX, but most people find it helpful as a visual aid when working with UI inside the JavaScript code. It also allows React to show more useful error and warning messages.</span></span>

<span key="2e5a8af72a394fa4a6dc38c21ef3a369"><span offset-key="2e5a8af72a394fa4a6dc38c21ef3a369:0">With that out of the way, let’s get started!</span></span>

## 

<span key="dbe2f55e2b5c4d84a649764f54742863"><span offset-key="dbe2f55e2b5c4d84a649764f54742863:0">Embedding Expressions in JSX</span></span>

<span key="ba46fff5d2fa49ee8b257a0df35ce013"><span offset-key="ba46fff5d2fa49ee8b257a0df35ce013:0">In the example below, we declare a variable called </span>`name`<span offset-key="ba46fff5d2fa49ee8b257a0df35ce013:2"> and then use it inside JSX by wrapping it in curly braces:</span></span>

1

<span key="2e62bbc8eb414efabd6646772557666c"><span offset-key="2e62bbc8eb414efabd6646772557666c:0">const name = 'Josh Perez';const element = &lt;h1>Hello, {name}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

2

<span key="9100eed1fef346a58e608155cb9adcfd"><span offset-key="9100eed1fef346a58e608155cb9adcfd:0">ReactDOM.render(</span></span>

3

<span key="25e9e96b642640cca36f19bb02887c8b"><span offset-key="25e9e96b642640cca36f19bb02887c8b:0"> element,</span></span>

4

<span key="5834f4513d354776923abce074f4fd14"><span offset-key="5834f4513d354776923abce074f4fd14:0"> document.getElementById('root')</span></span>

5

<span key="42aa721e85ff40a7ab4585aec01e3cc1"><span offset-key="42aa721e85ff40a7ab4585aec01e3cc1:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="b18baa998e784417a12f799f076536a1"><span offset-key="b18baa998e784417a12f799f076536a1:0">You can put any valid </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Expressions_and_Operators#Expressions" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f90cb642de0f4b1195b183f680fd2e03" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="14afd602fa484840808ad41a71578581"><span data-offset-key="14afd602fa484840808ad41a71578581:0">JavaScript expression</span></span></span></a><span key="c43746f76bf34d698c895f6de716f166"><span offset-key="c43746f76bf34d698c895f6de716f166:0"> inside the curly braces in JSX. For example, </span>`2 + 2`<span offset-key="c43746f76bf34d698c895f6de716f166:2">, </span>`user.firstName`<span offset-key="c43746f76bf34d698c895f6de716f166:4">, or </span>`formatName(user)`<span offset-key="c43746f76bf34d698c895f6de716f166:6"> are all valid JavaScript expressions.</span></span>

<span key="7b904a5b66014aba8fdfab53d54e64b7"><span offset-key="7b904a5b66014aba8fdfab53d54e64b7:0">In the example below, we embed the result of calling a JavaScript function, </span>`formatName(user)`<span offset-key="7b904a5b66014aba8fdfab53d54e64b7:2">, into an </span>`<h1>`<span offset-key="7b904a5b66014aba8fdfab53d54e64b7:4"> element.</span></span>

1

<span key="428a9fa9923a444c8334a0d7aeebeb6d"><span offset-key="428a9fa9923a444c8334a0d7aeebeb6d:0">function formatName(user) {</span></span>

2

<span key="c09dc0a9d1d842de8592d569ae4fccc2"><span offset-key="c09dc0a9d1d842de8592d569ae4fccc2:0"> return user.firstName + ' ' + user.lastName;</span></span>

3

<span key="a4d1918c57984c2ab4488a283c40d4d8"><span offset-key="a4d1918c57984c2ab4488a283c40d4d8:0">}</span></span>

4

<span key="678da7068ebe49c5894b3c995a477a13"><span offset-key="678da7068ebe49c5894b3c995a477a13:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

5

<span key="f7b13fd675cf4725ba1c5aa22f67efd5"><span offset-key="f7b13fd675cf4725ba1c5aa22f67efd5:0">const user = {</span></span>

6

<span key="84eea9e5ace04762aa6cacf8fbd4fd15"><span offset-key="84eea9e5ace04762aa6cacf8fbd4fd15:0"> firstName: 'Harper',</span></span>

7

<span key="806b8d9550aa422e96f2d2dda4c4237b"><span offset-key="806b8d9550aa422e96f2d2dda4c4237b:0"> lastName: 'Perez'</span></span>

8

<span key="55f309977c08413b9ef0577f2a930386"><span offset-key="55f309977c08413b9ef0577f2a930386:0">};</span></span>

9

<span key="3195b6ecf9ab45b6a5bc1317f088130f"><span offset-key="3195b6ecf9ab45b6a5bc1317f088130f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

10

<span key="ef5639f5dae94498a3f4bf202a560490"><span offset-key="ef5639f5dae94498a3f4bf202a560490:0">const element = (</span></span>

11

<span key="95a3fdcde2db45dab7961a05942c3974"><span offset-key="95a3fdcde2db45dab7961a05942c3974:0"> &lt;h1></span></span>

12

<span key="d91a9b9ab2354775ab513d433f7c4a45"><span offset-key="d91a9b9ab2354775ab513d433f7c4a45:0"> Hello, {formatName(user)}! &lt;/h1></span></span>

13

<span key="7d2428e2f854430fbdee4721680a92a1"><span offset-key="7d2428e2f854430fbdee4721680a92a1:0">);</span></span>

14

<span key="e6db11e1d3d34de6900c4f832a484569"><span offset-key="e6db11e1d3d34de6900c4f832a484569:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

15

<span key="d1885a7c14d642a280f560d6150d25c5"><span offset-key="d1885a7c14d642a280f560d6150d25c5:0">ReactDOM.render(</span></span>

16

<span key="d92c913c94d34eea87aa569a891710a5"><span offset-key="d92c913c94d34eea87aa569a891710a5:0"> element,</span></span>

17

<span key="6d09eb5724a2478bb9adfd2fce752358"><span offset-key="6d09eb5724a2478bb9adfd2fce752358:0"> document.getElementById('root')</span></span>

18

<span key="f6a531dad12d4bcd90b04a91a1e13a63"><span offset-key="f6a531dad12d4bcd90b04a91a1e13a63:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="5e336ee7da1e4d8c94892bd7efbd0267"><span offset-key="5e336ee7da1e4d8c94892bd7efbd0267:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/redirect-to-codepen/introducing-jsx" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="024c26c9661f46ab863fd281c02fab8a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="2b7d3712214e4c3797a8b6f609b2b2d4"><strong>Try it on CodePen</strong></span></span></a><span key="59da6793ac4f432d92f0797137736613"><span offset-key="59da6793ac4f432d92f0797137736613:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="2b08df9acf7e48369ee32d76036de549"><span offset-key="2b08df9acf7e48369ee32d76036de549:0">We split JSX over multiple lines for readability. While it isn’t required, when doing this, we also recommend wrapping it in parentheses to avoid the pitfalls of </span></span><a href="https://stackoverflow.com/q/2846283" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="44d8c0afcefa4d398fc3cb821784d752" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="67a8bee4a906417bb2d660475d723b89"><span data-offset-key="67a8bee4a906417bb2d660475d723b89:0">automatic semicolon insertion</span></span></span></a><span key="f1c4687b2a41476999b088fe173b6b20"><span offset-key="f1c4687b2a41476999b088fe173b6b20:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="97a7a3dcffad4691a0979fdfe62462bc"><span offset-key="97a7a3dcffad4691a0979fdfe62462bc:0">JSX is an Expression Too</span></span>

<span key="b894b95e42ac4f31865cde989efa528b"><span offset-key="b894b95e42ac4f31865cde989efa528b:0">After compilation, JSX expressions become regular JavaScript function calls and evaluate to JavaScript objects.</span></span>

<span key="a69bea2bde8e404bbf3a1e306544dc8d"><span offset-key="a69bea2bde8e404bbf3a1e306544dc8d:0">This means that you can use JSX inside of </span>`if`<span offset-key="a69bea2bde8e404bbf3a1e306544dc8d:2"> statements and </span>`for`<span offset-key="a69bea2bde8e404bbf3a1e306544dc8d:4"> loops, assign it to variables, accept it as arguments, and return it from functions:</span></span>

1

<span key="21d20fb2da8f4dbf8325a56eaacc4d2f"><span offset-key="21d20fb2da8f4dbf8325a56eaacc4d2f:0">function getGreeting(user) {</span></span>

2

<span key="59f39df3b408472b82b9594f4370545d"><span offset-key="59f39df3b408472b82b9594f4370545d:0"> if (user) {</span></span>

3

<span key="79173d9f44084252bbfd018f4a2cc85b"><span offset-key="79173d9f44084252bbfd018f4a2cc85b:0"> return &lt;h1>Hello, {formatName(user)}!&lt;/h1>; }</span></span>

4

<span key="7f38673f0901480bb52ba14195c5f55f"><span offset-key="7f38673f0901480bb52ba14195c5f55f:0"> return &lt;h1>Hello, Stranger.&lt;/h1>;}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="a433618a3eb34fe1a99b06fede607e0e"><span offset-key="a433618a3eb34fe1a99b06fede607e0e:0">Specifying Attributes with JSX</span></span>

<span key="a533b044f9304ad4b268ae3330782096"><span offset-key="a533b044f9304ad4b268ae3330782096:0">You may use quotes to specify string literals as attributes:</span></span>

1

<span key="1fdf574bcc5842b5b2cda330a8b68f62"><span offset-key="1fdf574bcc5842b5b2cda330a8b68f62:0">const element = &lt;div tabIndex="0">&lt;/div>;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="6ad957a0ec87426eb25d323fbf38edf4"><span offset-key="6ad957a0ec87426eb25d323fbf38edf4:0">You may also use curly braces to embed a JavaScript expression in an attribute:</span></span>

1

<span key="dfdfe80c0af74d1d82756f7ff0aa4819"><span offset-key="dfdfe80c0af74d1d82756f7ff0aa4819:0">const element = &lt;img src={user.avatarUrl}>&lt;/img>;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="1fb03cb058fc471caeda1c1eb37e8ab2"><span offset-key="1fb03cb058fc471caeda1c1eb37e8ab2:0">Don’t put quotes around curly braces when embedding a JavaScript expression in an attribute. You should either use quotes (for string values) or curly braces (for expressions), but not both in the same attribute.</span></span>

> <span key="32a0710cb26d49439f65b05c75685d57">**Warning:**</span>
>
> <span key="8e480bbd661e415eafe98a8f07d855d5"><span offset-key="8e480bbd661e415eafe98a8f07d855d5:0">Since JSX is closer to JavaScript than to HTML, React DOM uses </span>`camelCase`<span offset-key="8e480bbd661e415eafe98a8f07d855d5:2"> property naming convention instead of HTML attribute names.</span></span>
>
> <span key="f7a5e288aad2407d860e05251d1b8efa"><span offset-key="f7a5e288aad2407d860e05251d1b8efa:0">For example, </span>`class`<span offset-key="f7a5e288aad2407d860e05251d1b8efa:2"> becomes </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/className" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cb6162905f344740bf9d15f7aabbf30d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="53fce70afa824e7d8de8711f8f35e9f1"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="53fce70afa824e7d8de8711f8f35e9f1:0">className</code></span></span></a><span key="43a2fb31aeef455a8ffba6ddc53ee9d9"><span offset-key="43a2fb31aeef455a8ffba6ddc53ee9d9:0"> in JSX, and </span>`tabindex`<span offset-key="43a2fb31aeef455a8ffba6ddc53ee9d9:2"> becomes </span></span><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/tabIndex" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="96249604e14346b4aae17a6f7c43ab4f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="2a64686c7e184f3b8cdde8b0415a1ac5"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="2a64686c7e184f3b8cdde8b0415a1ac5:0">tabIndex</code></span></span></a><span key="bd9f9e49f53143229b2b58e37cfa65ee"><span offset-key="bd9f9e49f53143229b2b58e37cfa65ee:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="24f64ae8c7654263b0d6652a2d3ffce7"><span offset-key="24f64ae8c7654263b0d6652a2d3ffce7:0">Specifying Children with JSX</span></span>

<span key="0ddd673b2a15463fa25ab1607672ab6a"><span offset-key="0ddd673b2a15463fa25ab1607672ab6a:0">If a tag is empty, you may close it immediately with </span>`/>`<span offset-key="0ddd673b2a15463fa25ab1607672ab6a:2">, like XML:</span></span>

1

<span key="4711c0ae1bee408182734001bca0955b"><span offset-key="4711c0ae1bee408182734001bca0955b:0">const element = &lt;img src={user.avatarUrl} />;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="ed7d117570d84beb89db8bc1ef88efc1"><span offset-key="ed7d117570d84beb89db8bc1ef88efc1:0">JSX tags may contain children:</span></span>

1

<span key="d8b304e595cb4ef7ae05a95c2c8862ec"><span offset-key="d8b304e595cb4ef7ae05a95c2c8862ec:0">const element = (</span></span>

2

<span key="bd1e547d1616485f88fce289c01a967c"><span offset-key="bd1e547d1616485f88fce289c01a967c:0"> &lt;div></span></span>

3

<span key="b2abaa51e9844f00bf94f58d9c35481b"><span offset-key="b2abaa51e9844f00bf94f58d9c35481b:0"> &lt;h1>Hello!&lt;/h1></span></span>

4

<span key="2dd464a4a7f24f74a7e82380c9213880"><span offset-key="2dd464a4a7f24f74a7e82380c9213880:0"> &lt;h2>Good to see you here.&lt;/h2></span></span>

5

<span key="9a21dd3cc9a8485cb5848fb096c5f002"><span offset-key="9a21dd3cc9a8485cb5848fb096c5f002:0"> &lt;/div></span></span>

6

<span key="820c55183a204736be2434eb859527db"><span offset-key="820c55183a204736be2434eb859527db:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="f1084d26bd94459aa3900abad1b5706e"><span offset-key="f1084d26bd94459aa3900abad1b5706e:0">JSX Prevents Injection Attacks</span></span>

<span key="d9bb15b9292340b8bfab2d8da387728c"><span offset-key="d9bb15b9292340b8bfab2d8da387728c:0">It is safe to embed user input in JSX:</span></span>

1

<span key="541f40a8988747cba42a354df0b4620d"><span offset-key="541f40a8988747cba42a354df0b4620d:0">const title = response.potentiallyMaliciousInput;</span></span>

2

<span key="a529626a097946629704baf89e109573"><span offset-key="a529626a097946629704baf89e109573:0">// This is safe:</span></span>

3

<span key="739f73141a234a4286aae2c9898d4bac"><span offset-key="739f73141a234a4286aae2c9898d4bac:0">const element = &lt;h1>{title}&lt;/h1>;</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="08448966f45642719c744bd6ebecd077"><span offset-key="08448966f45642719c744bd6ebecd077:0">By default, React DOM </span></span><a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7381974/which-characters-need-to-be-escaped-on-html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="372cc4704b6144b187b1ac63dcbb79ba" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="99a5e091a03b46f5b9db6b2062328545"><span data-offset-key="99a5e091a03b46f5b9db6b2062328545:0">escapes</span></span></span></a><span key="d275904a78934a139876ed0cd45806b2"><span offset-key="d275904a78934a139876ed0cd45806b2:0"> any values embedded in JSX before rendering them. Thus it ensures that you can never inject anything that’s not explicitly written in your application. Everything is converted to a string before being rendered. This helps prevent </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cross-site_scripting" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3b61d441b0c2430680f6c8906951ccef" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="18b69c55ca5a4383abc4d98976bf3bf7"><span data-offset-key="18b69c55ca5a4383abc4d98976bf3bf7:0">XSS (cross-site-scripting)</span></span></span></a><span key="b6c8f5e65de744f79a3be359223568da"><span offset-key="b6c8f5e65de744f79a3be359223568da:0"> attacks.</span></span>

## 

<span key="3c54ca7039d449988f96b992e234911f"><span offset-key="3c54ca7039d449988f96b992e234911f:0">JSX Represents Objects</span></span>

<span key="58c94105cbc84b72a48fc73dadc25376"><span offset-key="58c94105cbc84b72a48fc73dadc25376:0">Babel compiles JSX down to </span>`React.createElement()`<span offset-key="58c94105cbc84b72a48fc73dadc25376:2"> calls.</span></span>

<span key="19b5a2297c3744218913991d89f5a0c6"><span offset-key="19b5a2297c3744218913991d89f5a0c6:0">These two examples are identical:</span></span>

1

<span key="b04c5ecf8e5f48888e265af49a873621"><span offset-key="b04c5ecf8e5f48888e265af49a873621:0">const element = (</span></span>

2

<span key="bcfbbca5706046709c53cb590128210a"><span offset-key="bcfbbca5706046709c53cb590128210a:0"> &lt;h1 className="greeting"></span></span>

3

<span key="d861678c0a00407cb6cad36f03a4bd02"><span offset-key="d861678c0a00407cb6cad36f03a4bd02:0"> Hello, world!</span></span>

4

<span key="09f182b98b334dbdbde5ccd487363b00"><span offset-key="09f182b98b334dbdbde5ccd487363b00:0"> &lt;/h1></span></span>

5

<span key="b8bd30a7e8df45998138587a7617ae23"><span offset-key="b8bd30a7e8df45998138587a7617ae23:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

1

<span key="64f5157220414f90b5492d3471027c0e"><span offset-key="64f5157220414f90b5492d3471027c0e:0">const element = React.createElement(</span></span>

2

<span key="abfdbc26d0a748649c4b9d36845cbb72"><span offset-key="abfdbc26d0a748649c4b9d36845cbb72:0"> 'h1',</span></span>

3

<span key="4c939037e68f40c7b5761b148e7d7004"><span offset-key="4c939037e68f40c7b5761b148e7d7004:0"> {className: 'greeting'},</span></span>

4

<span key="d5d63e14a0ae4aa182c7b85b1cb8a07b"><span offset-key="d5d63e14a0ae4aa182c7b85b1cb8a07b:0"> 'Hello, world!'</span></span>

5

<span key="f6606e07456646d1b69341ed61d8a5a8"><span offset-key="f6606e07456646d1b69341ed61d8a5a8:0">);</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="3b965c21729f4ed5aeae7b9c4d0197e5">`React.createElement()`<span offset-key="3b965c21729f4ed5aeae7b9c4d0197e5:1"> performs a few checks to help you write bug-free code but essentially it creates an object like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="842e93156c054183b990fbe670932876"><span offset-key="842e93156c054183b990fbe670932876:0">// Note: this structure is simplified</span></span>

2

<span key="a0b289a1011847239024d4b5872f2587"><span offset-key="a0b289a1011847239024d4b5872f2587:0">const element = {</span></span>

3

<span key="d7a54665b1cc48aa9ab9abed891e8456"><span offset-key="d7a54665b1cc48aa9ab9abed891e8456:0"> type: 'h1',</span></span>

4

<span key="f0286942b8e044d4a7c0897ee81599ba"><span offset-key="f0286942b8e044d4a7c0897ee81599ba:0"> props: {</span></span>

5

<span key="59624b40e508418581999a1b070cc015"><span offset-key="59624b40e508418581999a1b070cc015:0"> className: 'greeting',</span></span>

6

<span key="799ba6b5645547d2bd6185bd2c2497f2"><span offset-key="799ba6b5645547d2bd6185bd2c2497f2:0"> children: 'Hello, world!'</span></span>

7

<span key="264c58103064442fb8f118bf58c8183d"><span offset-key="264c58103064442fb8f118bf58c8183d:0"> }</span></span>

8

<span key="21114bde862a4714a8d8daef946fa57f"><span offset-key="21114bde862a4714a8d8daef946fa57f:0">};</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="073e1a32130244c3a3c0802da342c677"><span offset-key="073e1a32130244c3a3c0802da342c677:0">These objects are called “React elements”. You can think of them as descriptions of what you want to see on the screen. React reads these objects and uses them to construct the DOM and keep it up to date.</span></span>

<span key="039285558f42482bbed2e25d87f49791"><span offset-key="039285558f42482bbed2e25d87f49791:0">We will explore rendering React elements to the DOM in the </span></span><a href="https://reactjs.org/docs/rendering-elements.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fc6d2344a5ba4646ace6d5142a8fbeae" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="ec0c7d63a4da4558ba8fd69bd326b4c3"><span data-offset-key="ec0c7d63a4da4558ba8fd69bd326b4c3:0">next section</span></span></span></a><span key="9b7d55db52354b3dbc449c62a7db8483"><span offset-key="9b7d55db52354b3dbc449c62a7db8483:0">.</span></span>

> <span key="274f496373814fb782a665d50b41ea3a">**Tip:**</span>
>
> <span key="8cc528c7675146aa8d9699c329c1cee4"><span offset-key="8cc528c7675146aa8d9699c329c1cee4:0">We recommend using the </span></span><a href="https://babeljs.io/docs/en/next/editors" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="aa75050ae4054f3089c85ce0f246e829" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-4108_259-4109-237__"><span data-key="22621e3fc9db4a5aae95e5020fe353a9"><span data-offset-key="22621e3fc9db4a5aae95e5020fe353a9:0">“Babel” language definition</span></span></span></a><span key="18f01bb4f4c14bb99ee0e51d6b6996e3"><span offset-key="18f01bb4f4c14bb99ee0e51d6b6996e3:0"> for your editor of choice so that both ES6 and JSX code is properly highlighted.</span></span>

<a href="components-and-props.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1rasi3h r-1472mwg r-1vzi8xi r-lrsllp" />

Contents

Introducing JSX

<a href="jsx.html#why-jsx" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

Why JSX?

<a href="jsx.html#embedding-expressions-in-jsx" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

Embedding Expressions in JSX

<a href="jsx.html#jsx-is-an-expression-too" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

JSX is an Expression Too
